Job Title: Vice President, End User Technology: VIP Support

Job Description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG's shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization's extensive global network. The Group's operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $132,000.00 and $156,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.



SMBC Americas Division is seeking a to join our newly formed Agile Product team within the Business Intelligence & Strategic Data department. This role will focus on building a robust ESG Sustainability Data Platform using Microsoft Power Platform, Azure, and other modern technologies. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in software development principles and experience building scalable, secure, and user-friendly solutions.


Design and develop custom solutions using Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and SharePoint Online.
Build reusable components and ensure adherence to DRY principles, entity modeling, and SDLC best practices.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate ESG requirements into technical solutions.
Integrate with external systems and data sources, including Azure services and SQL databases.
Support data governance, quality assurance, and interoperability with Tokyo Head Office systems.
Mentor junior developers and contribute to Agile ceremonies and sprint planning.
Ensure regulatory readiness and compliance through robust system design.


10+ years of software development experience, including 5+ years with Microsoft Power Platform.
Strong understanding of software engineering fundamentals: entity management, data modeling, design patterns.
Experience with C#, Azure, and SharePoint Online.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies, JIRA, and SDLC processes.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Ability to manage competing priorities and deliver high-quality solutions under tight deadlines.


Microsoft Power Platform certifications (Developer, Functional Consultant, Solution Architect).
Experience in ESG, compliance, or financial services domains.
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure preferred, AWS/Google Cloud Platform a plus).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proactive mindset.

SMBC is in the process of leading a Digital Transformation across our Americas Division as we continue to modernize our technology, focus on our data-driven approach, grow, and plan for the future. As a result of this expansion, we are seeking a software developer to join our Nikko development team.


Design, development, testing, support, and maintenance of software applications, risk systems and market data feeds.
The primary technology will be Python, SQL, C#/.Net, middleware IBM MQ for messaging, and AWS/Azure cloud.
In this position the candidate will work closely with Business Users, Business Analysts, Project managers, the infrastructure team, DBA team and other application teams across the organization.


7+ years of professional experience in Software Development for Brokerage Business domain (Front, Middle, and Back office solutions)
Hands-on development in Python and SQL programming
Strong knowledge of Python programming
Strong knowledge of SQL programming with ability to write and simplify complex queries, improve query performance, etc.
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to self-direct, analyze and evaluate and form independent judgments
Ability to effectively interact and build relationships with senior management and stakeholders
Strong project and people management skills
Excellent communication skills including experience speaking to technical and business audiences
Expertise in algorithms, system development methodologies, and software architecture design
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in financial domain
Experience with IBM MQ or other messaging tool
Experience with SOAP and REST API
Experience with cloud technologies (AWS and Azure)
Experience designing and architecting systems

Design, develop, implement and maintain data resources. Design and develop database structures for applications and systems, determine relational schema and set security policies. Determine hardware needs for database requirements, including server hardware and storage resources. Review reports and perform analysis of database growth and function for future resource planning.



Design, develop, implement and maintain data resources. Design and develop database structures for applications and systems, determine relational schema and set security policies. Determine hardware needs for database requirements, including server hardware and storage resources. Set back-up policies and schedules, and conduct testing of back-up and restore system. Review reports and perform analysis of database growth and function for future resource planning. Develop database code to improve performance and minimize storage and resource utilization. Implement fixes for any bugs identified by users. Conduct testing for data errors, structure and consistency.



Work with business unit leads to determine database requirements and retention polices, advise on performance goals, and develop capacity need and growth projections. Partner with IT system administrators to install and configure server and storage hardware, perform maintenance and upgrades, update security lists, and troubleshoot performance and hardware issues. Collaborate with application development team to determine capacity and resource requirements, build and maintain data exchange and API structures, and create automated jobs and tools. Engage with network administrators to develop and maintain telecommunication structures, network security policy and access lists, and troubleshoot and manage any connectivity issues.



Possess comprehensive understanding of database standards such as SQL, Oracle and Hadoop, as well as different database and data warehouse structures. Display knowledge of data exchange interfaces, APIs, data mining tools, data standardization and cleaning processes, and application interfaces. Demonstrate expertise with database maintenance tools, back-up and testing policies, security and access polices, error correction and validation utilities, and performance monitoring tools. Show ability to analyze database performance and develop improvements to database code to improve scalability and performance.

The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.



As a DevOps Engineer you will play a critical role binding the gap between development and operations. You will work closely with our software engineering, QA, infrastructure and security teams to design, implement and maintain a robust and scalable CICD solution to support mission-critical financial applications. Your expertise will ensure the seamless deployment of applications, while maintaining the highest levels of security, compliance and performance.



CICD Pipeline Management: design, develop and maintain Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment pipelines to streamline the software development process.

Infrastructure as Code - Implement and manage Infrastructure as Code using tools such as Terraform and Ansible to automate the provision and management of infrastructure.

Monitoring & Logging: develop and maintain comprehensive monitoring and logging solutions to ensure the reliability and performance of production systems.

Security & Compliance: collaborate with security teams to integrate security best practices into the DevOps processes, ensuring that all systems meet the stringent compliance requirements of the bank.

Cloud and On-Premise Infrastructure: manage both Cloud based (Azure) and on-premise (OpenShift/VM's) infrastructure, ensuring high availability and disaster recovery readiness.

Automation & Scripting: develop automation scripts using Python, Bash or similar as required to automate routine tasks.

Collaboration: work closely with development, QA, security and operations teams to ensure smooth and reliable application delivery and setting out best practice guidelines wherever possible.

Environment Stability: take part in the DevOps team Rota to monitor alerts across environments, reporting on issues and improving the monitoring stack as required.

Tooling development: help to build out the engineering platform that assists in improving developer experience and productivity.

Release and DR: deploy scheduled releases and DR weekend checkouts when required.

Job Title: Vice President, Senior Software Engineer - Capital Markets
Job Description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG's shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization's extensive global network. The Group's operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $166,000.00 and $205,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.



Design, develop and maintain decision support systems focused on evaluating finance operations such as trading and investment, credit, market risk and deal underwriting. Determine appropriate models to apply for the supported business function. Develop connection protocols and APIs to import data from various sources such as databases, trading platforms and market data services.



Create, develop and maintain decision support systems focused on evaluating finance operations such as trading and investment, credit, market risk and deal underwriting. Determine appropriate models to apply for the supported business function and set evaluation and error-checking systems. Develop connection protocols and APIs to import data from various sources such as databases, trading platforms and market data services. Create scripts to automate data import and formatting jobs. Create reporting tools and evaluation metrics to analyze system function and recommendation performance. Implement revisions based on analysis.



Work with business units and trading desks to evaluate their current analytical process and identify areas that present opportunities to be improved by decision support systems. Collaborate with quantitative analysis team to select and develop models based on business needs. Partner with application development team to create application features and functions, API and connectivity protocols, and reporting tools. Engage with database administration team to store and secure data for analysis, design jobs to import and standardize data, and monitor data for errors and inconsistencies.



Exhibit deep understanding of financial modeling and analytical frameworks and their application to different business functions. Demonstrate expertise with data processing and aggregation tools and platforms and how to integrate those with current business processes. Apply knowledge of current market data services and trading platform methods for automated data collection and standardization methods. Show understanding of different data storage techniques, such as relational databases and data warehouses, and methods of integrating multiple datasets for use with complex analytical models.



Hands-on development with Java as the primary language; experience with Java 17
Experience from working in the pricing and risk domain in investment banking
In-depth knowledge in Rates products
Strong fundamental Computer Science knowledge including Concurrency; Algorithms and data structures,
Proactive self-starter who is able to take initiative and roll up sleeves to get things done.
Scrum/agile methodology
Evidence of delivering application from inception, to design, and to production
Extensive experience of test driven development
Knowledge of CI/CD on large complex systems

The Risk VP role supports the operationalization of the Information Technology (IT) and Cybersecurity risk management framework for the SMBC Group Americas Division (AD), in accordance with applicable regulations, home office policies and industry practices for risk management.

The Risk Management Department (RMDAD) is the second line of defense in its role of monitoring and assessing business practices as related to the risk appetite framework for SMBC. Within the RMDAD, the Tech, Data and Cyber Risk Oversight (TDCRO) establishes technology, data and cyber risk management policies and framework with defined roles and responsibilities across first and second lines. The Technology Risk VP is responsible for providing second line review and challenge as part of the framework execution.

Job Title: Linux Systems Engineer - Ansible, OpenShift & Cloud
Job Description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG's shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization's extensive global network. The Group's operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.



We are looking for a Red Hat Linux Engineer with expertise in automation, container orchestration, and cloud infrastructure. This role will focus on managing and optimizing enterprise Linux environments, automating operations with Ansible, and deploying scalable applications using Red Hat OpenShift across cloud platforms. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing, maintaining, and automating enterprise-grade Linux environments, ensuring high availability, performance, and security across our infrastructure.


Administer and maintain Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) systems in hybrid cloud environments.
Develop and manage Ansible playbooks and roles for configuration management, provisioning, and orchestration.
Deploy, manage, and troubleshoot containerized applications on Red Hat OpenShift.
Collaborate with DevOps and cloud teams to ensure seamless integration and deployment pipelines.
Monitor system performance, ensure security compliance, and implement best practices for scalability and reliability.
Automate routine tasks and improve operational efficiency through scripting and infrastructure-as-code practices.
Participate in incident response, root cause analysis, and continuous improvement initiatives.
Participate in disaster recovery planning, patch management, and system upgrades.
Provide technical guidance and support to cross-functional teams.


3+ years of experience in Linux system administration, with a focus on Red Hat technologies.
Strong hands-on experience with Ansible for automation and configuration management.
Proficiency in deploying and managing applications on Red Hat Linux & OpenShift
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Familiarity with containerization, microservices architecture, and CI/CD pipelines.
Scripting skills in Bash, Python, or similar languages.
Familiarity with Git, Jenkins, and other DevOps tools.
Red Hat certifications (RHCE, RHCSA) or equivalent experience.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Ansible or other infrastructure-as-code tools.
Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools (Prometheus, LogicMonitor, Cribl).
Understanding of security frameworks and compliance standards (e.g., CIS, NIST).

The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG's shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.



SMBC is in process of leading a Digital Transformation across our Americas Division as we continue to modernize our technology, focus on our data driven approach, grow and plan for the future.

As a result of this expansion, we are seeking an experienced Microsoft Power Platform developer position located in our Charlotte, NC location. In this position you will need to understand all facets of Power Apps development, administration, and be able to support the company SDLC process. This includes gathering business requirements, developing solutions, creating test cases, application lifecycle management, production support, and customer support. In addition, there will be a knowledge sharing aspect to the role as the company is in the early adoption phase of the Power Platform.



Application development in accordance with best practices.
Administration of environments.
Troubleshoot production issues and assist with production support.
Analyze business requirements and create design specifications for new applications and enhancements.
Test, debug, and refine application code based on specified requirements.
Prepare required documentation, including both program-level and user-level documentation.
Provide feedback to team management to ensure development/project deadlines are met.
Participate in knowledge sharing with other developers beginning development on the Power Platform.
This will include development of canvas and model driven apps with numerous data sources such as SharePoint Online, Oracle, SQL Server, and others.


2+ years of application development experience using the Power Platform
Power Apps Canvas and Model driven apps
Power Automate
Power BI
SharePoint Online
Dataverse and Microsoft Dynamics
DAX, Javascript, C#, and Typescript
Connectors
Application security
Data governance
Application monitoring
Experience working with waterfall or agile methodologies
Bachelor's Degree with relevant experience
It would be helpful if you have experience with:
Data modeling
Azure AD
Azure Storage
PowerShell
Azure DevOps
Logic Apps
Data Factory
Dataflows
Power Apps Data Gateways

Additional Skills:
Strong communication skills. Position will require working directly with different areas of the business.
Financial services or banking experience a plus.

Job Title: IAM Lead: Privileged Access Management (PAM) - Director
Job Description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.



This role will be part of the IAM Architecture and Engineering function within SMBC. The individual will work with the Group Companies to provide elegant solutions that adhere to the core principles of Zero-Trust, Just-In-Time and Just-Enough-Access but balance it with a frictionless experience for end users and applications. The ideal candidate must be a subject matter expert in IAM and be aware of modern authentication protocols and industry standards. The individual will play a key role in securing privileged identities, aligning PAM capabilities with zero trust and compliance frameworks, and use capabilities of products like CyberArk, Delinea (Thycotic), Microsoft Entra PIM, and other PAM toolsets.

The person in this role will assist with the definition of the strategy and design in coordination with the existing Infrastructure and Information Security teams, help establish standards and policies, develop implementation plans, and transition implementation and operational functions to applicable teams. An ideal candidate will have background and experience in the technologies and implementation methods related to both infrastructure and security architecture/engineering.


Member of a team that establishes and drives infrastructure architecture with a specific focus on security requirements and best practices in a global, hybrid, multi-cloud environment.
Work directly with Information Security to develop and promote infrastructure requirements within security-related initiatives and ensure that security requirements are integrated into infrastructure projects.
Increase operational and financial efficiencies through identification of opportunities to standardize security toolsets and practices within a multi-company environment.
Ensure that the proposed and existing infrastructure architectures are aligned with organizational goals and objectives.
Provide architecture collaboration with other architecture, engineering, and application teams, translating application team needs into technical solutions and product requirements.
Drive Infrastructure security and compliance requirements into the architecture framework.
Facilitate documentation of existing systems architecture and technology portfolios (e.g., architecture, configuration, and setup) and make recommendations for improvements and/or alternatives.
Provide effective knowledge transfer and upskilling to relevant Architecture and Engineering personnel.
Design with operations in mind. Look for ways to automate and improve operations.
Maintain strong relationships and identify opportunities for strengthening synergies between varying Infrastructure and IT Security teams.


Experience with identity infrastructure and synchronization technologies including Active Directory, Entra ID, LDAP, SAML, SCIM, EID Connect, Cloud Synch, and MIM.
Background in end-to-end identity provisioning/deprovisioning standards and best practices including HRIS to IdP relationships and attribute management.
Familiarity with authentication infrastructure, protocols, and access controls (GPO, Conditional Access, MFA, ADFS, Application Protection Policy, etc).
Familiarity with Microsoft native and competing security products such as Entra Identity Governance, Entitlement Management, Defender, and Purview.
Understanding of endpoint management tools and standards including endpoint DLP, Defender for Cloud Apps, Intune endpoint management, and other policy frameworks.
Monitoring and logging tools such as Microsoft Sentinel, Cribl, Splunk, Cloudwatch, Cloudtrail, and MS Log Analytics.
Experience facilitating discussions with senior leadership regarding technical/architectural trade-offs, best practices, and risk mitigation.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG's shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization's extensive global network. The Group's operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.

The ideal candidate will possess deep expertise in Capital Markets, Agile Program Management, and Release Train Engineering, with a proven track record of managing large-scale portfolios and driving cross-functional collaboration across technology and business teams.

The IT Delivery Coordinator helps ensure IT service initiatives are executed successfully. Working with internal teams and business partners, this role coordinates solutions that improve the end user experience and supports planning, scheduling, and tracking of delivery efforts. The IT Delivery Coordinator will also support Service delivery reporting and operational coordination across desktop support while driving greater visibility and structure for both day-to-day support activity and critical support initiatives. This role plays helps drive stronger operational visibility, consistency and execution across support services.


Ensure consistency and accuracy of service delivery data across incidents, requests, walk-up activity, project tasks, and device asset records; maintain standard classification practices to improve reporting reliability
Produce recurring operational reports and trend analysis, including support volume, workload distribution, and support quality, using documentation completeness, trends, escalation tracking, and knowledge use analysis
Identify and address knowledge gaps by analyzing ticket trends and user feedback
Create executive dashboards to support service planning, staffing, and service improvement initiatives
Coordinate and track desktop-related initiatives such as office moves, site expansions, desk relocations, conference room technology builds, device refresh cycles, and workspace setups
Maintain structured service tracking, including task lists, timelines, dependencies, risks, and issue logs
Partner closely with channel partner teams to align implementation schedules, dependencies, and execution timelines
Support end-to-end coordination of IT service delivery tasks, ensuring timelines are met and deliverables are tracked
Assist in managing day-to-day operations related to desktop, mobile, and workplace technologies
Contribute to documentation of service processes, delivery plans, and reports that support continuous improvement


3-6 years' experience across IT operation analytics and reporting, IT Project Coordination and Business Analysis in an IT or Enterprise environment
Demonstrated ability to analyze operational data to identify trends, gaps and improvement opportunities
Proven experience supporting project coordination for office build out initiatives
Demonstrated experience performing data analysis, reporting and trend analysis within ServiceNow or similar ITSM platform
Familiarity with asset management, vendor coordination or process improvement
Bachelor's degree in information technology, Information Systems or relevant experience

SMBC is in the process of leading a Digital Transformation across our Americas Division as we continue to modernize our technology, focus on our data-driven approach, grow, and plan for the future. As a result of this expansion, we are seeking a software developer to join our AML Technology team to support Compliance applications, systems and services that ensure the bank meets all its legal and regulatory responsibilities and obligations in connection with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) efforts.



Establish / maintain thresholds, at-risk levels, and exposure limits. Prepare periodic reporting to analyze positions, compare to thresholds, and ensure compliance. Work with business unit to optimize risk / return, remediate and avoid exceptions, and identify root causes of non-compliance and variances to expected performance. Using existing risk models and guidelines, work with business unit to establish operational procedures, monitor compliance. Identify necessary changes to both risk models and operating procedures. Rationalize and optimize both transaction level controls and policies. Evaluate and approve exceptions according to clip levels. Ensure business partners are aware of their risk responsibilities (operational, market, credit, etc.) and provide knowledge of policies and procedures. Evaluate new products and customer classes to ensure adherence to policies and procedures. Test transactions for compliance with established policies. Assist in compliance, financial and regulatory examinations / audits.



Build your market perspective through relationships with market counterparties. Facilitate relationships with units such as treasury and client-facing functions to better understand the risks in their businesses and the instruments they handle. Improve workflows and data gathering / sharing through relationships with units such as finance, compliance, legal and IT. Network within the industry through meetings, events and involvement with trade organizations to better understand emerging risk trends and the products and clients of your business unit. Establish relationships with auditors and regulators to better understand their concerns and reduce potential compliance issues.





7+ years of professional experience in Software Development for Financial / Compliance domain
Strong knowledge of Python programming
Strong knowledge of SQL programming with ability to write and simplify complex queries, improve query performance, etc.
Application development experience using the Power Platform - Power Automate, Power BI, Connectors, Application security
Experience with cloud technologies (AWS and Azure)
Experience working with Agile development environments.
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to self-direct, analyze and evaluate and form independent judgments
Ability to effectively interact and build relationships with senior management and stakeholders
Excellent communication skills including experience speaking to technical and business audiences

We are seeking an experienced and visionary Head of Data Technology to lead the strategy, development, and delivery of enterprise data platforms supporting our global markets business. This role is critical in enabling high-quality, scalable, and compliant data solutions across trading, risk, and operations.


Define and execute a comprehensive data technology strategy aligned with the bank's business and regulatory objectives.
Oversee the architecture, development, and maintenance of platforms supporting Reference Data, Market Data, Security Data, and related domains.
Ensure systems are scalable, resilient, and compliant with data governance and regulatory standards.
Champion modernization initiatives across data platforms and practices.
Build, mentor, and manage a high-performing team of data engineers, architects, and technical leads.
Foster a culture of innovation, accountability, and continuous improvement.
Demonstrate leadership that emphasizes collaboration, transparency, accountability, and clear communication.
Drive talent development and succession planning across the data technology organization.
Lead the development and maintenance of enterprise data warehouses, data lakes, and data layers.
Ensure high availability, performance, and reliability of data platforms.
Promote best practices in data engineering, including modular architecture, metadata management, and data quality frameworks.
Leverage modern cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and other large-scale data technologies to deliver scalable solutions.
Collaborate with infrastructure and middleware teams to ensure seamless integration and optimal performance of data platforms.
Drive modernization efforts including cloud adoption, containerization, and microservices architecture.
Ensure data platforms support real-time and batch processing needs across the enterprise.
Build strong relationships with business leaders, technology peers, and enterprise partners to drive alignment and progress.
Partner with risk, compliance, and operations to understand priorities and deliver impactful data solutions.
Act as a liaison between technology and business stakeholders to ensure alignment and effective communication.
Manage relationships with external vendors and technology partners.
Stay abreast of industry trends in data architecture, analytics, and regulatory technology.
Drive innovation by exploring new tools, technologies, and methodologies to enhance data capabilities.
Lead initiatives to improve data accessibility, reduce operational risk, and enhance decision-making.
Apply SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) principles to improve delivery efficiency and cross-team collaboration.


15+ years of experience in data technology leadership roles, with deep expertise in enterprise data platforms.
Proven track record of delivering complex data solutions in a global financial services environment.
Strong understanding of Reference Data, Market Data, Security Data, and data governance principles.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and large-scale data technologies.
Familiarity with SAFe or other scaled agile methodologies.
Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to build strong relationships across business, technology, and enterprise functions to drive transformation and modernization.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field; Master's degree preferred.

Job Title: Information Technology, User Support Americas, VP, NY
Job Description:
About Us

Rothschild & Co is a leading global financial services group with seven generations of family control and a history of over 200 years at the centre of the world's financial markets.

Our expertise, intellectual capital and global network enable us to provide a distinct perspective that makes a meaningful difference to our clients, communities and planet.

We have 4,600 talented specialists on the ground in over 40 countries around the world, enabling us to deliver a unique global perspective across four market-leading business divisions - Global Advisory, Wealth Management, Asset Management and Five Arrows.

As a family-controlled business built on relationships, we place a huge emphasis on our people and finding the right colleagues to take our business forward.

Rothschild & Co is committed to an inclusive and supportive environment where different perspectives are valued. We are focused on the attraction and recruitment, development and retention and progression of high calibre talent to ensure we and our clients benefit from the value of difference.



The VP, IT User Support for the Americas will lead and manage end-user IT support services across offices in the U.S., Canada, Mexico, and Brazil. This role ensures consistent, high-quality, and customer-focused support, working closely with regional teams and stakeholders to maintain operational excellence. The position also plays a key role in supporting senior stakeholders and guiding support teams through complex or escalated issues.







Bachelor's degree in a relevant field in IT support leadership.



Expected base salary rates for this role in our New York Office will be between $130,000 and $175,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, salary offers are determined on an individualized basis and are based on a wide range of factors, including relevant skills, training, experience and education. Market and organizational factors are also considered. In addition to salary and our Rothschild & Co employee benefits package, successful candidates may be eligible to receive a discretionary bonus.

Rothschild & Co North America is an equal opportunity and employer.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access this career website.

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $228,000.00 and $265,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. We are seeking an experienced and visionary Head of FICC Technology to lead the development and delivery of technology solutions for our Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities (FICC) business. This role is critical in enabling efficient trading, risk management, and operational workflows across our global markets platform.


Develop and execute a comprehensive technology strategy for the FICC business aligned with the bank's commercial and regulatory objectives.
Oversee the design, development, and maintenance of trading, pricing, risk, and post-trade applications.
Ensure systems are scalable, resilient, and compliant with industry standards and regulations.
Champion modernization initiatives across platforms and practices.
Build, mentor, and manage a high-performing team of software engineers, architects, and technical leads.
Foster a culture of innovation, accountability, and continuous improvement.
Demonstrate leadership that emphasizes collaboration, transparency, accountability, and clear communication.
Drive talent development and succession planning across the FICC technology organization.
Lead the development of front-office and middle-office applications including trade capture, pricing engines, risk analytics, and market data integration.
Ensure timely and high-quality delivery of technology solutions to meet evolving business needs.
Promote best practices in software engineering, including modular architecture, automated testing, and performance optimization.
Provide technical oversight and guidance on Java-based application development.
Collaborate with infrastructure and middleware teams to ensure seamless integration and optimal performance of FICC platforms.
Drive modernization efforts including cloud adoption, containerization, and microservices architecture.
Ensure high availability and low latency of trading systems.
Build strong relationships with FICC business leaders, peers across technology, and enterprise partners to drive alignment and progress.
Partner with risk, compliance, and operations to understand priorities and deliver impactful solutions.
Act as a liaison between technology and business stakeholders to ensure alignment and effective communication.
Manage relationships with external vendors and technology partners.
Stay abreast of industry trends in electronic trading, data analytics, and regulatory technology.
Drive innovation by exploring new tools, technologies, and methodologies to enhance FICC capabilities.
Lead initiatives to improve system performance, reduce operational risk, and enhance user experience.
Apply SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) principles to improve delivery efficiency and cross-team collaboration.


15+ years of experience in technology leadership roles, with deep expertise in FICC systems.
Proven track record of delivering complex technology solutions in a global markets environment.
Strong understanding of trading workflows, market data, risk management, and regulatory requirements.
Hands-on experience with Java and related technologies in enterprise-scale systems.
Familiarity with SAFe or other scaled agile methodologies.
Deep knowledge of pricing, PnL, and FICC products such as CAPS, Index TRS, and other structured instruments.
Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to build strong relationships across business, technology, and enterprise functions to drive transformation and modernization.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field; Master's degree preferred.

Job Title: Cyber Security Analyst - Vulnerability Management - Associate
Job Description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG's shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization's extensive global network. The Group's operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.



As a Vulnerability Management Analyst, you will be a key part of a high performing SOC team, with a desire to continually improve and advance our capabilities to protect SMBC Group. You will bring your passion for Cybersecurity to a team of dedicated professionals and leverage this passion to ensure our vulnerability remediation activities are effective and efficient and that we keep pace with a rapidly changing threat landscape. You will help protect the Bank's networks, applications, and infrastructure by working with IT owners to identify and mitigate risks that may be targeted by threat groups.

The Vulnerability Management team is responsible for working with relevant stakeholders to identify, analyze, mitigate, and report on vulnerabilities. The goal is to take a proactive and risk-based approach to identifying and addressing gaps within SMBC to protect the Bank's network and data from a cyber-attack and in turn, protect its reputation and the trust of customers. In this role, you will be responsible for configuring scans, researching the latest threats, analyzing large datasets, conducting risk assessments, coordinating remediation of identified risks, and reporting on compliance levels and opportunities for improvement across the enterprise. Due to the rapidly growing technological footprint and threat landscape, this role requires a quick learner that is proactive, analytical, diligent, and organized. The role will require interaction with various teams to effectively communicate and address risk and promote the use of secure technologies in line with security standards.

The role offers the opportunity for a security professional to work in a challenging and complex enterprise environment, using leading edge tools and technologies.

SMBC is currently undertaking a comprehensive digital transformation throughout its Americas Division to modernize technology infrastructure and services. The mission of the Technology Operations team, within Infrastructure Technology, is to enable stakeholders to collaborate effectively, foster innovation, and accelerate processes. Enterprise Technology is evolving significantly by adopting updated workflows, implementing advanced cloud tools and architecture, increasing automation, and delivering actionable data insights.

As the Executive IT Support Lead for the Americas Division, you will play a critical leadership role within the Technology Operations team. Your responsibilities will include shaping and enhancing Technology Operations support, driving continuous improvement in the end-user experience for SMBC employees, resolving complex technical challenges, mentoring site leads, and supporting technology modernization initiatives. This position presents a unique opportunity to make a meaningful contribution to SMBC's ongoing digital transformation efforts.

This is an onsite position, 5 days per week, in the New York City office location.



Executive Support Delivery
Provide premium, desk-side and remote IT support for executives ensuring issues are resolved with accuracy and professionalism
Become an executive technology subject matter expert to anticipate future executive technology needs and proactively prevent disruptions
Support high profile meetings and conferences along with our dedicated AV support technician
Serve as a face of IT for Executives, combining responsiveness and precision to build trust Leadership and Mentorship
Serve as the escalation point for complex issues, taking ownership from issue escalation intake to complete resolution.
Mentor and develop junior staff, instilling best practices in troubleshooting, resolution documentation and customer service.
Lead by example in communication style, professionalism and relationship management
Partner with internal technology teams to coordinate escalations and ensure executive issues are resolve


Lead smaller initiatives to refine support processes and raise service standards
Introduce improvements to the overall executive service process that can be applied to standard service management
Stay current on all new technologies to get ahead of possible issues during implementation

Technologies
ServiceNow
Asset Management
SCCM
Cisco Webex / MS Teams / VTC Support
Windows 10 / 11 Support
Citrix / Virtual Environments
Apple iPhone/iPad
Automation / Scripting - PowerShell
Previous Banking / Trading Type experience


8-10+ years of experience in an end-user support role.
Relevant Certification / Education that demonstrates understanding of core concepts.
Microsoft Active Directory (User, group, and computer management)
Microsoft Windows Desktop Operating Systems - Windows registry, Group Policy, File/folder security concepts (NTFS/share permissions, etc.)
Microsoft Office/SharePoint/Teams/ One Drive
Microsoft SCCM
Citrix Workspace/XenDesktop Virtual Desktop Environments
Core networking concepts (DNS, DHCP, etc.)
Excellent customer service skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications and Skills
2-3 Years experience in a leadership role

The Director of Cloud Security Architecture will ensure bank's cloud infrastructures are securely architected, configured, deployed in accordance with the approved polices and standards by leveraging industry best practices and automation. You will be expected to broaden and sharpen our capability to manage the incoming security architecture needs while rapidly surfacing, driving down, and reporting on cloud security issues across our AWS, Google Cloud Platform, and Azure environments.

This role is responsible for identifying secure cloud architecture patterns, where appropriate automate deployments using IaC and manage security projects. This position requires participation in technical research and development to enable continuous innovation for Cyber Security and Information Risk department. Acts as a subject matter expert who utilizes his/her Cloud Security Engineering expertise to resolve complex problems in consideration of established policies, guidelines, or processes.


Implement the bank's cybersecurity strategy by architecting, engineering, deploying, and operating technical security controls as they related to virtual machines, storage, key vault, database services infrastructures in the Cloud.
Engineer and operate solutions that protect Cloud resources from malicious internal and external threats by providing additional preventative, detective, and hardening controls and by enabling Real Time endpoint detection and response capabilities.
You will automate security hardening tasks in Cloud to ensure gaps are identified and addressed quickly with our standards.
Performs as the Subject Matter expert focused on multiple technologies within the Security domains (Security Engineering, IAM, Cloud Security, Data Security, Network Security, Encryption, Privileged Access Management, Federation etc.).
Establishes a strategic security architecture vision, including standards and frameworks for medium to large enterprises.
Review and analysis of security logs from a wide variety of sources.
Coordinate and perform security audits and vulnerability assessments to assess internal security procedures and compliance requirements.
Work with relevant internal IT Application, Infrastructure, Network and Support teams to ensure that security controls are implemented at all significant layers, test those controls and perform gap analysis to find areas of improvement.
Perform testing to evaluate new products for network and system security controls.
Participate in the development of the security roadmap and communicate the Technology Security vision to senior management and technical departments.
Coordinates with project team the implementation, upgrade and maintenance of security solutions.



Critical Job Knowledge and Core Competencies/Skills:
7+ Years of hands-on security architecture, implementation and design experience required, designing globally scalable Cloud security solutions.
Cloud Security and hands on knowledge with Azure and AWS is highly desired.
Experience delivering large and complex programs - where you own the business or technical vision, collaborate with large cross-functional teams, secure commitments on deliverables and unblock teams to land business impact
Strong knowledge of enterprise Information Security pillars (Perimeter security, Identity Management and Governance, Privileged Account Management, Compliance, Penetration testing, Encryption, Cloud Security, Incident Response, Vulnerability Management)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; strong attention to detail.
Strong executive reporting and narrative based presentation skills.
Thirst for knowledge and constantly driven to stay current with evolving threat landscapes.

Hands-on experience with some of the following:
Docker and Kubernetes
Developing & securing Serverless applications
Security administration in AWS/Google Cloud Platform/Azure
CI/CD and DevOps Tooling (Git, Jenkins, DevOps)
Infrastructure as Code Tools (Terraform, CloudFormation)
Cloud native security related tools (Azure Sentinel, AWS Guard Duty, AWS WAF, Google Cloud Platform Security Center, WIZ.IO, CASB)
Cloud Network (VPC) engineering
The Nice to Haves
Azure Certifications - Solutions Architect, AWS Security Specialty
Google Cloud Platform Certifications - Associate Cloud Engineer, Professional Security Engineer
Security Engineer Certifications - CISSP, CompTIA Security+
Certifications in related areas (e.g. SANS, OSCP, CEH) are a plus

SMBC is in the process of leading a Digital Transformation across our Americas Division as we continue to modernize our technology, focus on our data driven approach, grow and plan for the future.

As a result of this expansion, we are seeking an experienced and seasoned Technology Manager for Data Governance as a part of the Data Management group. In this position you will be responsible for leading the team with the implementation and ongoing support of the data management practice. The successful candidate will be accountable for driving alignment on Data Governance Frameworks, implementing governance on the bank's strategic Databricks platform, and acting as a global lead and service owner for the banks Data Catalog and Data Quality tooling. Here you will ensure team member activities are in compliance with and aligned with the bank's strategic directives. This role is well versed in business objectives as determined by project priorities and seeks continuous improvement opportunities through automation and simplification of business processes. You will also have responsibilities for administrative tasks such as attendance, timesheets, resource planning and performance reviews.

As a Technology Manager you will work in partnership with the Chief Data and Analytics Office (CDAO) within the Americas Division and other business stakeholders to elicit and analyze data management requirements. In collaboration with the CDAO, you will utilize current products such as Collibra, CDQ, and SNOW as well as engage in bringing on new tools as needed with technology enablement to help us build a first-class enterprise data management practice.

Job Title: Member of Legal, Corporate & Commercial Counsel
Job Description:
At Anchorage Digital, we are building the world's most advanced digital asset platform for institutions to participate in crypto.

Anchorage Digital is a crypto platform that enables institutions to participate in digital assets through custody, staking, trading, governance, settlement, and the industry's leading security infrastructure. Home to Anchorage Digital Bank N.A., the first federally chartered crypto bank in the U.S., Anchorage Digital also serves institutions through Anchorage Digital Singapore, Porto by Anchorage Digital, and other offerings.

The company is funded by leading institutions including Andreessen Horowitz, GIC, Goldman Sachs, KKR, and Visa, with its Series D valuation over $3 billion. Founded in 2017 in San Francisco, California, Anchorage Digital has offices in New York, New York; Porto, Portugal; Singapore; and Sioux Falls, South Dakota. Learn more at anchorage.com, on X @Anchorage, and on LinkedIn.

In the fast-paced world of crypto, we must memorialize and protect our relationships in ways that stand the test of time. You will be tasked with helping the business analyze our core products and services, and provide counsel on the corresponding data privacy and security requirements. In addition, you will possess the intellect and curiosity to help us build privacy critical aspects for new business lines.

We have created the Factors of Growth & Impact to help Villagers better measure impact and articulate coaching, feedback, and the rich and rewarding learning that happens while exploring, developing, and mastering the capabilities and contributions within and outside of the Member of Legal, Corporate & Commercial Counsel role.















The Anchorage Village, what we call our team, brings together the brightest minds from platform security, financial services, and distributed ledger technology to provide the building blocks that empower institutions to safely participate in the evolving digital asset ecosystem. As a diverse team of more than 600 members, we are united in one common goal: building the future of finance by providing the foundation upon which value moves safely in the new global economy.

Anchorage Digital is committed to being a welcoming and inclusive workplace for everyone, and we are intentional about making sure people feel respected, supported, and connected at work-regardless of who you are or where you come from. We value and celebrate our differences and we believe being open about who we are allows us to do the best work of our lives.

Anchorage Digital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. Anchorage Digital considers qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with other legal requirements. "Anchorage Digital" refers to services that are offered either through Anchorage Digital Bank National Association, an OCC-chartered national trust bank, or Anchorage Lending CA, LLC a finance lender licensed by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation, License No. 60DBO-11976, or Anchorage Digital Singapore Pte Ltd, a Singapore private limited company, all wholly-owned subsidiaries of Anchor Labs, Inc., a Delaware corporation.

Protecting your privacy rights is important to Anchorage Digital, and we work to maintain the trust and confidence of our clients when handling personal or financial information. Please see our privacy policy notices here.

SMBC Americas Division is seeking a to join our newly formed Agile Product team within the Business Intelligence & Strategic Data department. This role will focus on building a robust ESG Sustainability Data Platform using Microsoft Power Platform, Azure, and other modern technologies. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in software development principles and experience building scalable, secure, and user-friendly solutions.


Design and develop custom solutions using Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and SharePoint Online.
Build reusable components and ensure adherence to DRY principles, entity modeling, and SDLC best practices.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to translate ESG requirements into technical solutions.

Mentor junior developers and contribute to Agile ceremonies and sprint planning.
Ensure regulatory readiness and compliance through robust system design.


10+ years of software development experience, including 5+ years with Microsoft Power Platform.
Strong understanding of software engineering fundamentals: entity management, data modeling, design patterns.
Experience with C#, Azure, and SharePoint Online.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies, JIRA, and SDLC processes.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Ability to manage competing priorities and deliver high-quality solutions under tight deadlines.


Microsoft Power Platform certifications (Developer, Functional Consultant, Solution Architect).
Experience in ESG, compliance, or financial services domains.
Knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure preferred, AWS/Google Cloud Platform a plus).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proactive mindset.

As a DevOps Engineer you will play a critical role binding the gap between development and operations. You will work closely with our software engineering, QA, infrastructure and security teams to design, implement and maintain a robust and scalable CICD solution to support mission-critical financial applications. Your expertise will ensure the seamless deployment of applications, while maintaining the highest levels of security, compliance and performance.



CICD Pipeline Management: design, develop and maintain Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment pipelines to streamline the software development process.

Infrastructure as Code - Implement and manage Infrastructure as Code using tools such as Terraform and Ansible to automate the provision and management of infrastructure.

Monitoring & Logging: develop and maintain comprehensive monitoring and logging solutions to ensure the reliability and performance of production systems.

Security & Compliance: collaborate with security teams to integrate security best practices into the DevOps processes, ensuring that all systems meet the stringent compliance requirements of the bank.

Cloud and On-Premise Infrastructure: manage both Cloud based (Azure) and on-premise (OpenShift/VM's) infrastructure, ensuring high availability and disaster recovery readiness.

Automation & Scripting: develop automation scripts using Python, Bash or similar as required to automate routine tasks.

Collaboration: work closely with development, QA, security and operations teams to ensure smooth and reliable application delivery and setting out best practice guidelines wherever possible.

Environment Stability: take part in the DevOps team Rota to monitor alerts across environments, reporting on issues and improving the monitoring stack as required.

Tooling development: help to build out the engineering platform that assists in improving developer experience and productivity.

Release and DR: deploy scheduled releases and DR weekend checkouts when required.

Job Title: Vice President, Senior Software Engineer - Capital Markets
Job Description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG's shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization's extensive global network. The Group's operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $166,000.00 and $205,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.



Design, develop and maintain decision support systems focused on evaluating finance operations such as trading and investment, credit, market risk and deal underwriting. Determine appropriate models to apply for the supported business function. Develop connection protocols and APIs to import data from various sources such as databases, trading platforms and market data services.



Create, develop and maintain decision support systems focused on evaluating finance operations such as trading and investment, credit, market risk and deal underwriting. Determine appropriate models to apply for the supported business function and set evaluation and error-checking systems. Develop connection protocols and APIs to import data from various sources such as databases, trading platforms and market data services. Create scripts to automate data import and formatting jobs. Create reporting tools and evaluation metrics to analyze system function and recommendation performance. Implement revisions based on analysis.



Work with business units and trading desks to evaluate their current analytical process and identify areas that present opportunities to be improved by decision support systems. Collaborate with quantitative analysis team to select and develop models based on business needs. Partner with application development team to create application features and functions, API and connectivity protocols, and reporting tools. Engage with database administration team to store and secure data for analysis, design jobs to import and standardize data, and monitor data for errors and inconsistencies.



Exhibit deep understanding of financial modeling and analytical frameworks and their application to different business functions. Demonstrate expertise with data processing and aggregation tools and platforms and how to integrate those with current business processes. Apply knowledge of current market data services and trading platform methods for automated data collection and standardization methods. Show understanding of different data storage techniques, such as relational databases and data warehouses, and methods of integrating multiple datasets for use with complex analytical models.



Hands-on development with Java as the primary language; experience with Java 17
Experience from working in the pricing and risk domain in investment banking
In-depth knowledge in Rates products
Strong fundamental Computer Science knowledge including Concurrency; Algorithms and data structures,
Proactive self-starter who is able to take initiative and roll up sleeves to get things done.
Scrum/agile methodology
Evidence of delivering application from inception, to design, and to production
Extensive experience of test driven development
Knowledge of CI/CD on large complex systems

The Risk VP role supports the operationalization of the Information Technology (IT) and Cybersecurity risk management framework for the SMBC Group Americas Division (AD), in accordance with applicable regulations, home office policies and industry practices for risk management.

The Risk Management Department (RMDAD) is the second line of defense in its role of monitoring and assessing business practices as related to the risk appetite framework for SMBC. Within the RMDAD, the Tech, Data and Cyber Risk Oversight (TDCRO) establishes technology, data and cyber risk management policies and framework with defined roles and responsibilities across first and second lines. The Technology Risk VP is responsible for providing second line review and challenge as part of the framework execution.

Job Title: Linux Systems Engineer - Ansible, OpenShift & Cloud
Job Description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG's shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization's extensive global network. The Group's operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.



We are looking for a Red Hat Linux Engineer with expertise in automation, container orchestration, and cloud infrastructure. This role will focus on managing and optimizing enterprise Linux environments, automating operations with Ansible, and deploying scalable applications using Red Hat OpenShift across cloud platforms. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing, maintaining, and automating enterprise-grade Linux environments, ensuring high availability, performance, and security across our infrastructure.


Administer and maintain Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) systems in hybrid cloud environments.
Develop and manage Ansible playbooks and roles for configuration management, provisioning, and orchestration.
Deploy, manage, and troubleshoot containerized applications on Red Hat OpenShift.
Collaborate with DevOps and cloud teams to ensure seamless integration and deployment pipelines.
Monitor system performance, ensure security compliance, and implement best practices for scalability and reliability.
Automate routine tasks and improve operational efficiency through scripting and infrastructure-as-code practices.
Participate in incident response, root cause analysis, and continuous improvement initiatives.
Participate in disaster recovery planning, patch management, and system upgrades.
Provide technical guidance and support to cross-functional teams.


3+ years of experience in Linux system administration, with a focus on Red Hat technologies.
Strong hands-on experience with Ansible for automation and configuration management.
Proficiency in deploying and managing applications on Red Hat Linux & OpenShift
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Familiarity with containerization, microservices architecture, and CI/CD pipelines.
Scripting skills in Bash, Python, or similar languages.
Familiarity with Git, Jenkins, and other DevOps tools.
Red Hat certifications (RHCE, RHCSA) or equivalent experience.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Ansible or other infrastructure-as-code tools.
Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools (Prometheus, LogicMonitor, Cribl).
Understanding of security frameworks and compliance standards (e.g., CIS, NIST).

SMBC is in process of leading a Digital Transformation across our Americas Division as we continue to modernize our technology, focus on our data driven approach, grow and plan for the future.

As a result of this expansion, we are seeking an experienced Microsoft Power Platform developer position located in our Charlotte, NC location. In this position you will need to understand all facets of Power Apps development, administration, and be able to support the company SDLC process. This includes gathering business requirements, developing solutions, creating test cases, application lifecycle management, production support, and customer support. In addition, there will be a knowledge sharing aspect to the role as the company is in the early adoption phase of the Power Platform.



Application development in accordance with best practices.
Administration of environments.
Troubleshoot production issues and assist with production support.
Analyze business requirements and create design specifications for new applications and enhancements.
Test, debug, and refine application code based on specified requirements.
Prepare required documentation, including both program-level and user-level documentation.
Provide feedback to team management to ensure development/project deadlines are met.
Participate in knowledge sharing with other developers beginning development on the Power Platform.
This will include development of canvas and model driven apps with numerous data sources such as SharePoint Online, Oracle, SQL Server, and others.


2+ years of application development experience using the Power Platform
Power Apps Canvas and Model driven apps
Power Automate
Power BI
SharePoint Online
Dataverse and Microsoft Dynamics
DAX, Javascript, C#, and Typescript
Connectors
Application security
Data governance
Application monitoring
Experience working with waterfall or agile methodologies
Bachelor's Degree with relevant experience
It would be helpful if you have experience with:
Data modeling
Azure AD
Azure Storage
PowerShell
Azure DevOps
Logic Apps
Data Factory
Dataflows
Power Apps Data Gateways

Additional Skills:
Strong communication skills. Position will require working directly with different areas of the business.
Financial services or banking experience a plus.

The Risk VP role supports the operationalization of the Information Technology (IT) and Cybersecurity risk management framework for the SMBC Group Americas Division (AD), in accordance with applicable regulations, home office policies and industry practices for risk management.

The Risk Management Department (RMDAD) is the second line of defense in its role of monitoring and assessing business practices as related to the risk appetite framework for SMBC. Within the RMDAD, the Tech, Data and Cyber Risk Oversight (TDCRO) establishes technology, data and cyber risk management policies and framework with defined roles and responsibilities across first and second lines. The Technology Risk VP is responsible for providing second line review and challenge as part of the framework execution.

Job Title: IAM Lead: Privileged Access Management (PAM) - Director
Job Description:
SMBC Group is a top-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG's shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization's extensive global network. The Group's operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.



This role will be part of the IAM Architecture and Engineering function within SMBC. The individual will work with the Group Companies to provide elegant solutions that adhere to the core principles of Zero-Trust, Just-In-Time and Just-Enough-Access but balance it with a frictionless experience for end users and applications. The ideal candidate must be a subject matter expert in IAM and be aware of modern authentication protocols and industry standards. The individual will play a key role in securing privileged identities, aligning PAM capabilities with zero trust and compliance frameworks, and use capabilities of products like CyberArk, Delinea (Thycotic), Microsoft Entra PIM, and other PAM toolsets.
